The online version contains supplementary material available at 10.1186/s12985-024-02374-2 . African swine fever virus (ASFV) is the etiological agent of African Swine fever .
The study led us to identify five natural compounds that inhibited virus-induced cytopathic effect (CPE) by greater than 50

Anti-inflammatory compounds, tetrandrine and berbamine, exhibited high levels of anti-ASFV activity . The antiviral effects of these compounds on mitigating virulent ASFV infection in PAMs were also confirmed . Both compounds, especially Tetrandine, markedly reduced the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines such as TNF-α that plays a key  Vero cells were washed with cold PBS and MTT solution [3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2, 5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide from Sigma-Aldrich, Germany]. The optical density (OD) was measured colorimetrically at 570
The virus was collected and titrated at 24 h post-infection . Vero cells were infected with the ASFV BA71V strain (MOI of 0.2 TCID) and treated with selected compounds at indicated concentrations .

Vero cells (2 × 10<sup>5) or PAM cells were grown in 24-well cell culture plates . Cells were exposed to compounds before being infected with ASFV and the compounds were then added at 2, 8, or 16 h post-infection . The infection was allowed to progress for 24, 48, or 72 h
The compounds belong to 17 distinct classes of natural compounds . The compounds are found in 17 different types of natural substances .

Berbamine and tetrandrine have significantly more complex chemical structures than the other three compounds . Pinoresinol is classified as a tetrahydrofuran lignan, whereas pinoresinols is classified . as a phenolic compound . berbamine is both phenolic compounds, while pinoresinsinol  is a tetra-frenal l

The two most potent compounds, berbamine and tetrandrine, were selected for further studies . Vero cells infected with ASFV were treated with berbamines at varying concentrations . The two compounds may exhibit antiviral activity at lower compound concentrations .

The suppression of ASFV replication by berbamine and tetrandrine tended to be greater when the virus was collected at 72 h post-infection compared to 24- and 48-h . This finding indicates that both compounds exerted their antiviral effects across multiple rounds of virus replication .

When berbamine and tetrandrine were added at the virus attachment substage, they decreased the ASFV yield from 5.03 ± 0.16 log HADU <sub>50 1  to 3.25 ± 0.09 log HADE: mL <sup>−  1  (
At 24 h post-infection, both berbamine and tetrandrine significantly reduced TNF-α, IL-1β, and IL-6 levels compared to the ASFV control by around 60–80% .

The screening of a library of natural compounds with anti-inflammatory properties led to the identification of five promising candidates . Tetrandrine displayed the most potent effect, achieving a 3.6 log reduction in viral titer .
